raw_text:
Based on the provided paper, I'll extract the structured information following the guidelines:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "We study the long-run effects of a big-push \"graduation\" program in Ethiopia",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Graduation program",
    "country": "Ethiopia",
    "region": "Tigray Region",
    "target_population": "Very poor households from government's food-for-work program (PSNP)"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": false,
      "cash_support_type": null,
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "Unlike in some program contexts, treated households did not receive additional short-term cash or food transfers beyond what was already available to them (and to control households) via the PSNP program"
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": [
        "livestock (sheep/goats)",
        "oxen",
        "beehives and colonies",
        "petty trade inputs"
      ],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "Treatment households were offered one of four productive asset options, each meant to be worth roughly $270 USD in value at the time ($1,371 2021 USD PPP): (1) 16 sheep or goats for fattening, (2) two oxen for fattening, (3) two beehives and colonies, and (4) a comparable value of inputs for petty trade"
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "consumption/expenditure",
      "income/earnings",
      "food security/nutrition",
      "asset accumulation",
      "wealth",
      "savings/financial"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "The household survey included household member characteristics, housing, assets, income, consumption, food security, health spending and shocks",
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "Treatment status was determined via public lottery; we have no known instances of noncompliance with study design",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2010-2017",
    "sample_size": 925,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "Asset transfer worth $270 USD ($1,371 2021 USD PPP)",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "Treatment households were offered one of four productive asset options, each meant to be worth roughly $270 USD in value at the time ($1,371 2021 USD PPP)"
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "We study the long-run effects of a big-push \"graduation\" program in Ethiopia",
    "country_citation": "The study took place in ten tabias (wards that include three to four villages) in Tigray Region, Ethiopia",
    "target_population_citation": "Subjects were recruited from the government's food-for-work program, the Productive Safety Net Programme (PSNP)"
  }
}
```
